question: A 50-year-old woman has had a high fever over the past day. On physical examination she has papilledema. The gross appearance of her disease process is shown here. Which of the following laboratory test results is she most likely to have? <image 1>
options: A. Erythrocyte sedimentation rate of 50 mm/hr B. Serum lipase of 449 U/L C. Total serum complement of 45 mg/dL D. Serum carcinoembryonic antigen of 10 ng/mL E. Serum alanine aminotransferase of 123 U/L F. Proteinuria

question: Based on <image 1>, what's the most likely diagnosis?
options: A. first degree atrioventricular block B. third degree atrioventricular block C. Second degree type II atrioventricular block D. atrial flutter

question: What organ appears abnormal in this radiograph? <image 1>
options: A. Stomach B. Liver C. Gallbladder D. Duodenum

question: Can you see the finding on this x-ray of the pelvis? <image 1>
options: A. Fracture of the femoral neck B. Dislocation of the sacroiliac joint C. Foreign body in the midline at the level of the pubic symphysis D. Air the in bladder

question: What do these calcifications represent? <image 1>
options: A. Gallstones B. Pancreatic calcifications C. Calcified hematoma of the liver D. Hepatic artery aneurysms

question: A 53-year-old man suffers a cardiac arrest and his wife calls paramedics, who arrive a few minutes later and begin resuscitative measures. A regular heart rate is established after about 40 minutes of resuscitative efforts as he is being transported to the hospital. A thrombolytic agent is administered on admission. Which of the following cellular changes is most likely to now be occurring within his myocardium? <image 1>
options: A. Apoptosis B. Free radical injury C. Heterophagocytosis D. Squamous metaplasia

question: A 29-year-old G3 P2 woman has an uncomplicated pregnancy, and an ultrasound scan at 18 weeks gestation is completely normal. At 37 weeks she has the sudden onset of pelvic pain accompanied by passage of blood per vagina. Her membranes have not ruptured nor is she having labor contractions. Fetal monitoring reveals that the baby is in distress, and an emergent cesarean section is performed. The gross appearance of the placenta is shown here. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? <image 1>
options: A. Ectopic pregnancy B. Placenta previa C. Placenta accreta D. Molar pregnancy E. Abruptio placenta F. Pregnancy-induced hypertension

question: A 23-year-old G2 P1 woman has noted minimal fetal movement in the second trimester. An ultrasound scan at 19 weeks shows hydrops fetalis. A girl infant is born at 32 weeks gestation and is markedly icteric. The microscopic appearance of the placenta is shown here. Laboratory studies show the baby has a Hct of 18%, and an exchange transfusion is performed. Her first pregnancy was uncomplicated and resulted in the birth of a normal girl at term. Which of the following immunologic mechanisms is most likely to produce these findings? <image 1>
options: A. Anti-receptor antibody B. Immune complex formation C. Complement mediated cell destruction D. Delayed type hypersensitivity E. Loss of self tolerance

question: The picture shows the microscopy of Mr Tan's gastric tumour. Which of the following statements is CORRECT?  <image 1>
options: A. The findings show an adenoma B. The findings show a squamous cell carcinoma C. The findings show intestinal type adenocarcinoma D. The findings show diffuse signet ring cell adenocarcinoma

question: A 49-year-old man has had marked chest pain for the last 4 hours. An EKG shows ST segment elevation. Laboratory studies show cardiac troponin of 10 ng/mL. The representative gross appearance of his disease process is depicted here. Which of the following findings is most likely to occur in this man? <image 1>
options: A. Liquefactive necrosis B. Caseous necrosis C. Coagulative necrosis D. Wet gangrene

question: Where would a loss of taste be expected? <image 1>
options: A. 1 and 2 B. 2 and 3 C. 3 and 4 D. 2, 3, and 4

question: A 61-year-old woman comes to her physician because of a change in the appearance of her right breast over the past 7 months. On physical examination the skin overlying the breast is indurated, roughened, and reddish-orange. There is nipple retraction. The gross appearance of the cut surface of her subsequent mastectomy specimen is shown here. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? <image 1>
options: A. Infiltrating ductal carcinoma B. Intraductal carcinoma C. Phyllodes tumor D. Lobular carcinoma in situ

question: You are shown subtraction <image 1>, T2 weighted <image 2> and T1 weighted axial <image 3> images from a screening breast MRI. What is the etiology of the finding in the left breast?
options: A. Susceptibility artifact B. Hematoma C. Fat necrosis D. Silicone granuloma

question: A patient comes in complaining of abdominal pain and the doctor orders an x-ray of the abdomen. Afterwards, you compare it to the last image the patient had taken and you see this x-ray. What is the name of this x-ray position? <image 1>
options: A. KUB (Kidneys, ureter, and bladder) B. Lateral Decubitus C. Upright Abdominal x-ray D. IVP (Intra venous Pyelogram)

question: The patient shown below most likely has: <image 1>
options: A. Osteoarthritis B. Rheumatoid arthritis C. Septic arthritis D. Avascular necrosis

question: A 45-year-old man complains of a severe, constant headache for the past 2 days. He is noted on physical examination to have papilledema on the right. He becomes obtunded. The representative gross pathologic appearance of a complication in this man is shown here. Which of the following conditions is most likely to produce this gross finding? <image 1>
options: A. Parkinson disease B. Berry aneurysm rupture C. Glioblastoma D. Multiple sclerosis E. Meningococcemia

question: A 32-year-old woman has the acute onset of fever, cough, and dyspnea as she is preparing to leave her work and go home. When she gets home the symptoms have abated. This scenario is repeated on multiple occasions over the next 6 weeks. On physical examination she has no abnormal findings. A transbronchial biopsy is performed after she is hospitalized with respiratory distress. The microscopic appearance of the biopsy is shown here. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? <image 1>
options: A. Influenza viral pneumonia B. Hypersensitivity pneumonitis C. Diffuse alveolar damage D. Miliary tuberculosis

question: Identify the following rhythm: <image 1>
options: A. Normal Sinus Rhythm B. Sinus Tachycardia C. NSR with PAC'c D. NSR with 1st Degree AV Block E. NSR with PVC's F. Junctional Tachycardia

question: A 48-year-old woman has experienced episodes of sharp abdominal pain for the past month. On physical examination there is tenderness upon palpation of her right upper quadrant. Laparoscopic surgery is performed and the gross appearance of her disease process is depicted here. Which of the following is the most likely risk factor for her disease? <image 1>
options: A. Gilbert disease B. Cytomegalovirus infection C. Hemolytic anemia D. Ulcerative colitis E. Obesity

question: What is this rhythm? <image 1>
options: A. Normal Sinus Rhythm B. Sinus Bradycardia C. Accelerated Junctional Rhythm D. NSR with 1st Degree AV Block E. Idioventricular Rhythm F. Paced with Failure to Capture

question: This patient came in complaining of severe abdominal pain. Why is this an emergency? The patient has: <image 1>
options: A. A ruptured gastric ulcer. B. A ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm. C. Acute appendicitis. D. Acute renal failure.

question: A 33-year-old man goes to his physician for a routine check of his health status. On physical examination he has the skin lesions seen here. These lesions have not increased in size since childhood. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? <image 1>
options: A. Keratoacanthomas B. Seborrheic keratoses C. Fibroepithelial polyps D. Nevocellular nevi E. Epidermal inclusion cysts

question: Which organ(s) are abnormally large in this abdominal radiograph? <image 1>
options: A. Kidneys B. Small Intestines C. Liver D. Spine

question: The patient shown below has had abdominal pain for a week. What is the most likely diagnosis? <image 1>
options: A. Large bowel obstruction B. Small bowel obstruction C. Generalized ileus D. Localized ileus

question: A 39-year-old woman has noted a 'bump' on her neck for the past 6 months. On physical examination there is a firm, well-circumscribed, non-tender nodule to the right of midline in her neck. She undergoes thyroidectomy and the microscopic appearance of the lesion is shown here. Which of the following statements regarding her disease is most appropriate? <image 1>
options: A. The serum TSH is probably increased B. She will probably survive for at least 10 years C. Anti-microsomal and anti-thyroglobulin antibodies are detectable D. A dietary iodine deficiency probably preceded its appearance E. The patient has relatives with a similar condition

question: What person's name is associated with the fracture shown below? <image 1>
options: A. Monteggia B. Bennett C. Jones D. Colle

question: A 31-year-old G2 P1 woman gives birth at 38 weeks gestational age to a male infant. However, the placenta cannot be delivered, and there is extensive hemorrhage. She undergoes emergent hysterectomy, and the gross appearance of the uterus is shown here. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? <image 1>
options: A. Abruptio placenta B. Placenta accreta C. Chorioamnionitis D. Twin placenta E. Partial mole

question: A 45-year-old woman has had a severe headache with nausea and vomiting for the past 2 days. On physical examination her blood pressure is 290/160 mm Hg. Laboratory studies show her serum creatinine is 3.7 mg/dL. The representative microscopic appearance of her kidneys is depicted here. Which of the following underlying diseases is she most likely to have? <image 1>
options: A. Hepatitis C B. Breast carcinoma C. Diabetes mellitus D. Diffuse scleroderma

question: Which histological feature consistent with Crohn's disease is highlighted in part A? <image 1>
options: A. Fissuring ulcer B. Sinus tract C. Fistula formation D. Non-caseating granuloma

question: A 70-year-old woman collapses suddenly after ambulating to the bathroom from her hospital bed. At autopsy she has the gross pathologic finding shown here. Which of the following conditions is the most likely risk factor for development of this woman's immediate cause of death? <image 1>
options: A. Blunt chest trauma B. Inhalation of inorganic dusts C. Prolonged immobilization D. Bronchopneumonia
